text: Katherine Marie Helmond (July 5, 1929Intelius indicate she was born in 1929, as does the 1930 U.S. census at ancestry.com, which gives her age in 1930 as less than one year - February 23, 2019) was an American film, theater and television actress and director, who portrayed Emily Dickinson on Meeting of Minds, as well as fictional characters, for which she was best-known, such as Jessica Tate on Soap, Mona Robinson on Who's the Boss?, Doris Sherman on Coach, and Lois Whelan on Everybody Loves Raymond and Mrs. Lowry in Brazil. Helmond was born in Galveston, Texas on July 5, 1929.Katherine Helmond profile at movies.yahoo.com She was married to George N. Martin from 1957 until they divorced in 1962. She married her second husband David Christian in 1962. She has no children. Helmond died on February 23, 2019, from complications of Alzheimer's disease at her home in Los Angeles. aged 89. ==References== ==Other websites== * * Category:1929 births Category:2019 deaths Category:Deaths from Alzheimer's disease Category:American movie actors Category:American television actors Category:American stage actors Category:American voice actors Category:American television directors Category:Golden Globe Award winning actors Category:People from Galveston, Texas
title: Katherine Helmond
